job_details.title: Senior Electrical Design and Analysis Engineer
job_details.security_clearance: U.S. Secret Clearance required (interim and/or final post-start)
job_details.signing_bonus: Up to $15,000 based on candidate eligibility

other: Paid and unpaid time off programs

job_description.summary: The Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS) organization is seeking a Senior Electrical Design and Analysis Engineer to support the AWE&C team in Oklahoma City, OK. This position requires serving as a technical lead avionics engineer with expertise in flight deck avionics domains.
position_responsibilities: Serve as a technical lead avionics engineer with expertise in one or more flight deck avionics domains such as autoflight, communications, indication, recording, or navigation (FMS, ELT, TACAN, ADIRS, WXR, RNSS, EGPWS, EDFCS, CDS, or FDR/CVR)
Lead and review the work of engineering teams, ensuring technical accuracy, adherence to standards, and alignment with project goals
Mentor and develop early career engineers by fostering their technical growth in avionics communication, navigation, indication, and recording systems
Act as the primary technical point of contact for the AEW&C platform in high-level technical discussions, design reviews, and certification decision-making
Provide expert troubleshooting and technical support for fielded avionics hardware and software throughout the product lifecycle
Collaborate with program managers, customers, and cross-functional teams to define, review, and validate detailed flight deck avionics system and subsystem requirements
Translate requirements into robust system, subsystem, hardware, and software designs and interface specifications
Oversee and coordinate aircraft testing activities, including avionics functional test and installation and checkout procedures
Manage supplier technical performance and integration efforts, reviewing supplier deliverables for compliance
Research, evaluate, and recommend emerging technologies for potential integration into company avionics systems

required_qualifications.education: Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering (with focus in Electrical, Mechanical or Aeronautical), Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Chemistry
required_qualifications.experience: 8 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience in avionics system design, integration, testing, and certification
required_qualifications.citizenship: U.S. Citizenship required for security clearance

preferred_qualifications: Extensive experience in flight deck avionics integration, testing, and certification, including hands-on work with flight deck avionics systems
In-depth knowledge of civilian and/or military aircraft certification processes and FAA regulations related to avionics systems
Experience with relevant standards such as DO-178C, DO-254, ARINC 429/664, MIL-STD-1553, or RTCA/DO-160
Master's degree or higher (e.g., PhD) in Electrical Engineering from an ABET-accredited institution or equivalent technical education specializing in avionics or aerospace systems
additional_requirements: Drug Free Workplace - subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol
Export Control compliance - U.S. Person required
